Cell.Data: This function is dangerous with user controlled parameters and in the case of mobile devices should be regarded with suspicion - sensitive data should not be stored on the device.
Function returns an Intent message that has been passed to the application. Data from Intents should be considered untrusted and be validated for length, data type, content etc.

Creates a local file on the device. This function is dangerous with user controlled parameters and in the case of mobile devices should be regarded with suspicion - sensitive data should not be stored on the device.

This function acts as an entry point for external data and the code should be manually checked to ensure the data obtained is correctly validated and/or sanitised. Additionally, carefull checks/sanitisation should be applied in any situation where the user may be able to control or affect the filename.
